abstract: A panel on Thursday at the College Board conference in New York City emphasized the importance of honest and full disclosure of a student's behavioral or criminal infractions.
snippet: A panel on Thursday at the College Board conference in New York City emphasized the importance of honest and full disclosure of a student's behavioral or criminal infractions.
lead_paragraph: For those students worried about how disciplinary infractions may affect them in the admissions process, be assured that colleges are not black-and-white in their assessments of behavioral and criminal histories.

headline.main: Disclose Disciplinary Infractions, Admissions Officials Say
